These radio stations will make available programs that will engage radio listening clubs after live interviews and Questions and Answers

column1: en: The team performed in Zolokere on Friday 14th October, 2022, our first outing with the new performance.
column2: ny: Gululi linakapanga zionetsero ku Zolokere, lachisanu pa 14 October 2022, ulendo umene unali woyambilira ndi zionetsero zatsopanozi.

column1: en: We travelled around Rumphi with Lugo Cultural Team, who did an amazing dance and music performance and hosted a question and answer session in each place.
column2: ny: Tinayenda mumadera aku Rumphi ndi gulu la Lugo Cultural Team, limene linayimba ndi kuvina mopatsa chidwi kwambiri, komanso pali ponse pamene timayima timakhala ndi nthawi ya mafunso ndi mayankho ndi gulu la anthu limene talipeza kumeneko.

column1: en: We saw the local netball teams play and the football teams The Young Rangers played vs Monga Youth Club; we were very pleased with how many people came to see the first show!
column2: ny: Tinaonerera masewera a mpira wa manja wa atsikana, komanso masewera a mpira wa anyamata, pamene a Young Rangers anasewera ndi Monga Youth Club; tinakondwa kwambiri ndi kuchuluka kwa anthu amene anabwera kudzaonera zionetsero zathu zoyambilirazi.

column1: en: On Saturday 15th October,2022 we took the performance to Kamphenda, where the truck travelled around the area before the event playing music loudly to attract the attention of the local people.
column2: ny: Loweruka pa 15 October, 2022 tinakapanga zionetsero zathuzi ku Kamphenda, kumene chi tharaki chathu chinazungulira mu delali ndi nyimbo zomvekera patali pokopa anthu kuti abwere kudzaonera zionetserozi.

column1: en: It was market day and so again we had a great turn out. Kamphenda played vs KK Rangers in the football match and the local netball teams played a great game too.
column2: ny: Linali tsiku la msika ndiye kunabweranso anthu ambiri kwabasi. Timu ya mpira ya Kamphenda inasewera ndi KK Rangers ndiponso ma timu a mpira wamanja nawonso anasewera mpira wokoma kwabasi.

column1: en: On Sunday 16th October,2022, for our last performance in Rumphi we went to the village of Bowe, where we received a warm welcome from local villagers.
column2: ny: Tsiku Lamulungu pa 16 October, 2022, zionetsero zathu zomaliza ku Rumphi zinatitengera ku dera lotchedwa Bowe kumene tinalandiridwa mwamsangala kwambiri ndi anthu akumeneko.

column1:
en: On Sunday 16th October,2022, for our last performance in Rumphi we went to the village of Bowe, where we received a warm welcome from local villagers. 
The teachers in each local village were essential in helping us ask the audiences questions about the activities, which will be important for our research. There was a great football match between Bowe vs Betere and the local netball teams played really well too.
This, being our last performance in Rumphi, was very successful and we had lots of good questions about African Trypanosomiasis from the crowd.
column2: ny: Aphunzitsi asukulu zamumaderamu anathandzira kwabasi kufunsa mafunso anthu makamaka pofuna kudziwa kuti zionetsero zathu zakhala zopindulitsa bwanji kwaiwo, zimene zili zothandizira mu kafukufuku wathu. Kunali mpira wabwino kwambiri pakati pa Bowe ndi Betere, komanso osewera mpira wa manja anaseweranso bwino kwambiri. Mwambowu, umene unali womaliza ku Rumphi, unatha bwino kwambiri ndiponso tinalandira mafunso abwino kwambiri okhudzana ndi matenda a kasembe, kuchokera ku khwimbi limene linabwera.

column1: en: On Friday 21st October,2022 in Nkhotakota our team performed with local dancers Chiusi Kanada Dance Group and the Gule Wamkulu dancers, creating an amazing spectacle which drew crowds from the surrounding areas.
column2: ny: Tsiku Lachisanu pa 21 October 2022 ku Nkhotakota, gulu lathu linaonetsera zochitikachitika zimene zinakopa anthu ambiri kuchokera ku madera ozungulira.

column1: en: Our first performance was in Sasani, as part of a football and netball bonanza, where Bata Sasani played a great game vs Young Stars and our Talk About Tsetses performance was very well received.
column2: ny: Zionetsero zathu zoyamba zinachitikira kwa Sasani kumene ngati mbali ya masewero a mpira, timu ya Bata Sasani inasewera mpira wokoma ndi timu ya Young Stars, ndipo zionetsero zathu za Tikambe za Kashembe zinalandiridwa bwino.

column1:
en: We had an extremely warm welcome in Mwala Wa Tongole Saturday 22nd October 2022, when we were greeted with the local villagers singing in harmony as we arrived. 
The local football match between Young Challengers vs Ngala Stars was great; and also netball game between the local teams was exciting. Our performance was well received with good questions from the audience. Our performance was well received with good questions from the audience.
column2: ny: Tinalandiridwa bwino kwambiri ku Mwala wa Tongole pa tsiku Loweruka pa 22 October 2022, pamene tinalonjeredwa ndi anthu a madera osiyanasiyana anali akuyimba pamene tinkafika. Mpira wa pakati pa timu ya Young Challengers ndi Ngala Stars unayenda bwino kwambiri; komanso mpira wa manja wa ma timu a atsikana unalinso wokondweretsa kwambiri. Zionetsero zathu zinalandiridwa bwino kwambiri ndi mafunso abwinonso kuchokera ku gulu limene linabwera kudzaonelera.

column1: en: Our last performance of the project took place in Bamba on Sunday 23rd October, 2022 and there was a football match between Mthirah vs Red Rangers and a fantastic local netball match too.
column2: ny: Chionetsero chathu chomaliza pa Projecti yi chinatitengera ku malo otchedwa Bamba pa tsiku Lamulungu pa 23 October, 2022 ndipo kunali mpira pakati pa ma timu a mpira a Mthirah ndi Red Rangers, komanso mpira wa manja woti unasangalatsanso kwabasi.

column1: en: Malawi Tour 2022
column2: ny: Ulendo wa ku Malawi mu 2022

column1: en: Our team of performers, scientists, community members and dancers took our newly-developed Talk About Tsetses performance and giant tsetse fly to areas affected by African sleeping sickness in Rumphi and Nkhotakota over a period of 2 weeks in October 2023.
column2: ny: Gulu lathu la a zionetsero, a sayansi, anthu ochokera mumidzi ndi anthu ovina anatengera zionentsero zathu zatsopano za "Tikambe za Kashembe" ndi chi kashembe chachikulu ku madela amene akuvutika ndi matenda a kashembe ku Rumphi ndi Nkhotakota pa nthawi yokwanira ma sabata awiri mu mwezi wa October 2023.

column1: en: Our activities were part of local football and netball bonanzas in villages in the areas and we were joined by dance and music troupes from the local communities. We hosted question and answer session at each performance to encourage conversation about African Trypanosomiasis.
column2: ny: Zochitikachitikazi zinali gawo limodzi la masewero a mpira wa anyamata ndi mpira wa manja wa atsikana mu midzimu, ndipo kunabweranso ovina zachikhalidwe ochokera mu mudzi momo. Tinakonzanso nthawi ya mafunso ndi mayankho pa zionetsero za kuli konse kumene timapitako, kuti tilimbikitse kukambirana za matenda a kashembe amtundu wamu Africa.

column1: en: Performance at Partick Thistle Stadium
column2: ny: Zionetsero ku Stadiyamu ya Partick Thistle

column1: en: The Street Scientists performed on Saturday, 6 August 2022 at Furhill Stadium, during the half time break of the Scottish Championship Football League game between Partick Thistle Football Club and Hamilton Academical.
column2: ny: A katswiri a Sayansi wa anapanga zionetsero zawo Loweruka pa 6 August 2022 ku Stadiyamu ya Furhill, pa nthawi yopumira pamene kunali masewera a mpira mu Ligi ya Scottish Championship, pakati pa Partick Thistle Football Club ndi Hamilton Academical.

column1: en: The performance got a loud ovation from the cheering crowds.
column2: ny: Potha pa zionetserozi anthu anakuwa ndikuombera m'manja poyamikira.

column1: en: Partick Thistle Chief Executive, Gerry Britton, said: When researchers at the University of Glasgow reached out to us late last season about the prospect of performing an educational street theatre performance ahead of their trip to Malawi, it was a no-brainer for us to give them the platform to rehearse"
column2: ny: Mkulu wa timu ya Partick Thistle, a Gerry Britton, anati "Pamene azakafukufuku ochokera ku Univesite ya Glasgow anatipeza kumamaliziro a ligi ya chaka chatha kudzakamba nafe zoti adzapange ziwonetsero zawo pokonzekera ulendo wawo wa ku Malawi, kwa ife sizinafunikenso kuganiza kawiri kapena katatu koma kuwavomera ndikuwapatsa mpata woti adzapange zionetsero zawo ngati gawo lokonzekera."

column1: en: The team is getting set to fly out to Malawi in the coming weeks, where The Parasite Street they will do public engagement work surrounding infectious diseases.
column2: ny: Gululi likukonzekera kupita ku Malawi mu masabata otsatirawa, kumene atakapange zionetsero zokhudzana ndi matenda ofalikira.

column1: en: This after engaging the public at the Furhill Stadium, Glasgow, Scotland on Saturday 6 August 2022.
column2: ny: Uku ndi kutsatira kwa mambo wa zionetsero umene unachitika ku Sitediyamu ya Furhill ku Glasqow m'dziko la Scotland pa 6 August 2022.

column1: en: PUBLIC STATEMENT ON THE FUTURE OF MALAWI LEADERSHIP
column2: ny: UTHENGA KWA FUKO LA MALAWI PA TSOGOLO LA UTSOGOLERI WA DZIKO

column1: en: Introduction
column2: ny: Mawu oyamba

column1: en: Fellow Malawians, it is with great conviction and patriotism for my country, that I have decided to speak on issues that are affecting us all. I say conviction and patriotism for my country because in taking this stand, I am well aware of the associated risks to me personally, my family and my colleagues. However, my personal comfort plays subordinate to the national good. It is on that basis that I have braved to make this statement.
column2: ny: A Malawi anzanga, zanditengera kutsutsika mu mtima ndi kukonda dziko lathu, kuti ndilankhule nanu pa nkhani zomwe zikutikhudza tonse. Ndikunena kuti kutsutsika mu mtima ndi kukonda dziko lathu chifukwa pochita izi, ndikudziwa bwino za zoopsa zomwe zingabwere kwa ine, a pa banja anga komanso anzanga. Komatu ine ndimakhulupirira kuti umtambasale wanga usamakhale wofunika koposa ubwino wa fuko la Malawi. Ndi ganizo limeneri, ndalimba mtima kuti ndiyankhule.

column1: en: I am inspired by the many brave Malawians who have come before me. From the time of Reverend John Chilembwe to Dr. Kamuzu Banda, who fought against a white establishment for us to attain political independence. I am inspired by the likes of Dr. Bakili Muluzi, late Chakufwa Chihana, late Aleke Banda and all those who braved the one-party system in the early 1990s for us to have democracy. These Malawians knew the risks so well but put the interest of the nation far ahead of their personal interests. If it were not for their sacrifices, perhaps we would until today be under colonial rule or under one-party system. This statement I am making is a fruit of their sacrifices. I am personally indebted to them all.
column2: ny: Ndine olimbikitsidwa ndi aMalawi ambiri olimba mtima omwe adatenga mbali zaka zapitazo. Kuyambira nthawi ya m'busa John Chilembwe mpaka Dr. Kamuzu Banda, omwe adalimbana ndi ulamuliro wa azungu kuti tipeze ufulu wodzilamulira. Ndine olimbikitsidwa ndi omwe adalimba mtima kulimbana ndi ulamuliro wa chipani chimodzi kuti tikhale ndi demokalase. Awa ndi monga Dr. Bakili Muluzi, malemu Chakufwa Chihana, malemu Aleke Banda ndi ena ambiri. AMalawi amenewa ankadziwa mavuto obwera chifukwa chotenga mbali posintha ndale koma adaika zofuna za dziko patsogolo. Pakadapanda kudzipereka kotere, mwina mpaka lero tikanakhala pansi pa ulamuliro wachitsamunda kapena pansi pa ulamuliro wa chipani chimodzi. Ineyo kukhala ndi mwai wokuyankhulani ndi chipatso cha ntchito imene anthu amenewa adagwira. Ndine wothokoza kwa makolo athu amenewa.

column1: en: Malawi is a country well-endowed with natural resources and a predominantly youthful and energetic human resource which unfortunately is currently under- utilized. Malawi has everything required for her people to economically develop except it lacks effective leadership. Our development challenges have remained the same. Economic growth rate remains low, children still learn under a tree, health facilities are poorly resourced, some people have yet to have access to safe drinking water, agriculture is largely rain-fed and subsistence, markets for agricultural produce are weak and unpredictable, few people own houses in urban areas and only few houses in rural areas are permanent, transport system is inefficient and expensive, university students from low income households continue to face the risk of withdrawal on account of lack of tuition fee or upkeep expenses, small and medium enterprises cannot grow because the business environment is less conducive and some districts have yet to have tarmac road until now.
column2: ny: Dziko la Malawi liri ndi zonse zofunika kuti anthu ake atukuke pachuma kupatula kuti tiribe utsogoleri wodziwa ntchito, wa ngwiro ndi wotumikira nzika zake. Ana a sukulu akuphunzirabe pansi pa mitengo. Zipatala zilibe mankhwala ndi zipangizo zokwanira. Madera ena anthu akumwa madzi oyipa. Ulimi siwukutukuka. Alimi alibe misika yogula pa mtengo wopereka phindu ku zokolola zawo. Anthu ambiri wokhala mmizinda ndi ma matauni amakhala nyumba za eni zolipira. Mtengo wa minibus kupita ku ntchito ndi ku bizinezi ndi wokwera kwambiri. Wophunzira ena ku university sakumaliza maphunziro awo chifukwa chosowa ndalama za fizi komanso kugula chakudya. Mabizinezi ang’ono ang’ono akulephera kukula chifukwa malonda sakuyenda. Madera ena mpaka pano, zake 58 tikudzilamulira tokha, sadakhale ndi nseu wa phula.

column1: en: In fact, if one reads the priorities in the 1965 Nyasaland Development Plan and compare with priorities in the Statement of Development Policies in 1970s to mid- 1990s, then read Vision 2020 and then read Malawi 2063, it is clear that our priorities have remained the same. The reason they have remained the same is because they remain challenges because we have not made noticeable improvement as a country. The reason they remain challenges is because no leadership has addressed any key priority exhaustively. We still discuss food insecurity. We still discuss poor access to safe drinking water. We still discuss lack of all-weather roads in some areas. We still discuss poor access to electricity. We still discuss lack of profitable markets for farmers. We still discuss high unemployment especially among the youth.
column2: ny: Ndondomeko za chitukuko kuyambira pamene tidalandira ufulu wodzilamulira kufika pano zakhala zikukamba zinthu zimodzimodzi zoyenera kuchita. Chifukwa chokambira zinthu zimodzimodzi ndi chifukwa zinthuzo zikanali mavuto amene tikukumana nawo. Palibe utsogoleri umene udabwera nkuthetsa vuto motheratu. Mfundo zathu za chitukuko zimakambabe zothetsa njala, zobweretsa madzi akumwa, za kukonza misewu, kuchepa ndi kuzimazima kwa magetsi, kusowa kwa misika yodalirika ndi yogula pa mtengo wabwino kwa alimi komanso tikadalimbana ndi ulova kwenikweni kwa achinyamata.

column1: en: Economy
column2: ny: Chuma

column1: en: Fellow Malawians, our economy remains small, vulnerable to shocks and we continue carrying the Least Developed Country label. Even more irritating is that countries which have been at war or in conflict have economies stronger than ours. The weak economy we have is not the make of nature. It is the make of our leaders. While acknowledging periods of progress, such periods have been episodic and short-lived.
column2: ny: A Malawi anzanga, dziko lathu likadali mu gulu la maiko osaukitsitsa pa dziko lapansi. Chokhumudwitsa kwambiri n’chakuti mayiko amene akhala ali pa nkhondo kapena pamikangano ali ndi chuma champhamvu kuposa chathu. Chuma chofooka chomwe tili nacho sichinthu chachilengedwe. Ndi mapangidwe a atsogoleri athu. Ndivomereze kuti pakhala nthawi zina zimene chuma chathu chimaoneka kuti chayamba kuyenda bwino koma nthawi yotere yakhala ya apa ndi apo komanso nthawi yochepa. Kwa nthawi yayitali mu ufulu odzilamulira tokha chuma chathu chakula monyentchere.

column1: en: Malawi has capacity to feed itself and other countries given its abundant water resources for irrigation. Malawi has capacity to substitute imports and to increase exports and in so doing improve her balance of payments, stabilize exchange rate and contain inflation rate. Malawi has capacity to manage its own budget without heavy borrowing.
column2: ny: Dziko la Malawi liri ndi kuthekera kodzidyetsa lokha komanso kudyetsa maiko ena. Dziko la Malawi liri ndi kuthekera kopanga katundu wambiri lokha ndikuchepetsa katundu wogula kunja, potero ndikuthandiza kuti ndalama zakunja zomwe timapeza ndi ndalama za kunja zimene timazifuna zidzikwanirana. Zikatero mitengo ya katundu imakhala yotsika komanso yokhazikika. Dziko la Malawi liri ndi kuthekera koyendetsa ndondomeko ya ndalama (budget) kugwiritsa ntchito ndalama zimene timatolera ku misonkho ndi njira zina popanda kutenga ngongole zambiri.

column1: en: Sadly, people we have put in position of power to advance our common interests have opted to pursue personal interests, maintain luxuries and perpetuate the status quo at the expense of common Malawians whom they are meant to serve. There is both outright impunity and institutionalized impunity. An example of institutionalized impunity is the heaping of allowance entitlements to cabinet members and senior government officers when middle and junior level officers continue earning low salaries.
column2: ny: Chomvetsa chisoni n’chakuti anthu amene tawaika m’maudindo kuti apititse patsogolo miyoyo yathu asankha kudzikundikira iwo eni ndipo sakufuna kusintha zinthu zimene ziri zolakwika zongowononga ndalama za boma. Anthu tikuponderezedwa njira zosiyanasiyana. Pali kupondereza kwa pa mbalambanda ndiye pali kupondereza kochita kukhazikitsidwa mu ndondomeko. Chitsanzo cha kupondereza kokhazikitsidwa mu ndondomeko ndi kudzikundikira ndalama za alawansi za nduna ndi achiwiri awo komanso akuluakulu ogwira ntchito za boma pamene maudindo a ogwira ntchito mu boma a pansi akulandira ndalama zochepa.

column1: en: We have a system which just fuel allowance entitlement of a cabinet member is worth more than a salary of a Principal Secretary and fuel allowance entitlement of a Principal Secretary is worth more than a salary of a middle level officer. The same is the case in state owned enterprises.
column2: ny: Taganizani kuti ndalama zopatsidwa kuti nduna idzigula mafuta a galimoti zimaposa malipiro a mlembi wamkulu mu unduna. Ndalama zopatsidwa kuti mlembi wamkulu adzigula mafuta a galimoti zimaposa malipiro a ofisala amene akuwayang’anira. Izi ziri chimodzimodzi mu makampani a boma.

column1: en: I stand with you; teachers, police officers, healthcare workers, agriculture extension workers and many others whose salary is a fraction of just one allowance entitlement of a senior public officer and a minister. Surely, this is institutionalized impunity and must stop.
column2: ny: Ine ndiri mbali ya inu; aphunzitsi, apolisi, ogwira ntchito zachipatala, alangizi a zaulimi ndi ena ambiri omwe malipiro anu ndi gawo chabe la alawansi imodzi ya akuluakulu ochepa a boma ndi nduna. Zowonadi, uku ndikuponderezana ndipo kuyenera kuthetsedwa.

column1: en: I stand with you parents whose children are learning under a tree. I stand with you families who are struggling to put food on the table. I stand with you families whose sick relatives are sent back from hospital without receiving treatment. I stand with you, university students, who are struggling to meet upkeep expenses. I stand with you who are looking for a job which you are not able to find. I stand with you farmers who have been at subsistence level without hope of growing to a higher level. Your next government will stand with you. It will be a government whose job is to offer solutions and will address the challenges you are facing. You can count on me.
column2: ny: Inetu ndiri ndi inu makolo amene ana anu akuphunzira pansi pa mtengo. Ndiri nanu mabanja amene mukuvutika kuti mupeze chakudya. Ndiri nanu mabanja amene abale anu wodwala awuzidwa ku chipatala kuti mankhwala kulibe. Ndiri nanu wophunzira ku university amene mukulephera kumaliza maphunziro anu chifukwa chosowa ndalama zolipira komanso kugula chakudya. Ndiri nanu inu nonse amene mukusaka mwai wa ntchito koma osayipeza. Ndiri nanu alimi ang’ono ang’ono amene ulimi wanu siwukupita patsogolo. Boma lanu limene libwere lidzakhala boma lopereka mayankho ndipo tidzathetsa zobetchera zimene zilipozi. Ine mundidalire chifukwa ndikudziwa bwino zoyenera kuchita kuti zinthu ziyende bwino kwa aliyense m'dziko muno.

column1: en: Fellow Malawians, I believe in the potential of our country and in Malawians. We read positive stories about economic success of Rwanda. Zambia has just changed narrative since their current government came in office later than our current government and we are hearing positive stories. There is no reason other than poor leadership, that stories for Malawi that make international news headlines are poverty, hunger and corruption involving high profile public officers.
column2: ny: A Malawi anzanga, ine ndimakhulupirira kuthekera kumene dziko lathu liri nako. Ndimakhulupiriranso kuthekera kwa inu aMalawi. Timamva nkhani zabwino za maiko azanthu monga Rwanda amene miyoyo ya anthu ikupita patsogolo. Zambia nayonso nyengo zawo zayamba kusintha zinthu zikuyenda bwino. Palibenso chifukwa kupatula utsogoleri wosadziwa ntchito, kuti nkhani za ku Malawi zomwe zimamveka ndi za umphawi, njala ndi ziphuphu zokhudza akuluakulu aboma.

column1: en: I feel the pain we are all going through in the tough economic times. I acknowledge that part of the reasons for the economic challenges are external factors such as a war in Ukraine and tropical cyclones. However, as I have said time and again in various media interviews, the external factors have just contributed. A large part of the challenges is our own making. The past national budgets by the current political administration were poorly prepared, not transformative and did not build foundation for macroeconomic stability. I said it in 2020 and have consistently said this. The problems we are going through were anticipated and I did not keep quiet, I shared my views then.
column2: ny: Ndikudziwa ululu womwe tonse tikudutsa m'nthawi ya mavuto a zachuma. Ndikuvomereza kuti zina mwazifukwa zamavuto azachuma ndi zinthu zakunja monga nkhondo ku Ukraine ndi madzi osefukira. Komabe, monga ndakhala ndikunena mobwerezabwereza ku nyumba zofalitsa nkhani, zinthu zakunja zangowonjezera chabe. Mbali yaikulu ya mavuto ndi chifukwa choyendetsa chuma molakwika. Mabajeti amene utsogoleri ukuyendatsa boma panowu akhala akupanga anali olakwika. Akhala mabajeti osayika maziko a mphamvu kuti chuma chidziyenda bwino. Ine nditaona kuti mfundo za chuma ndizolakwika, ngati nzika yofunira dziko langa zabwino, ndidayankhula kudzera nyumba zina zofalitsa nkhani komanso ndidalemba tsatane tsatane wa zolakwika ndi zoyenera kukonza. Chotero mavuto tikukumana nawo monga kukwera mitengo kwa katundu mowirikiza ndizoziputa dala. Ndizotsatira zobwera chifukwa chotsatira ndondomeko zolakwika za chuma.

column1: en: The fast-rising public debt is testimony of lack of fiscal discipline. We were reminded a month ago that every Malawian is carrying on our shoulders a debt burden of K600,000. Unfortunately, this is not debt that financed programs to improve the living standard of us all. This is debt that financed corruption and luxury of senior officers. There has been limited interest to reform the fiscal plan – to remove or reduce unnecessary expenditure items and to grow the revenue base by increasing resource allocation to productive sectors. Additionally, there has been high level inefficiency in government resulting in delays to approve projects. The State President himself and some ministers have admitted this in public. Delay to approve projects locks up foreign exchange since most projects are donor- funded, delays job opportunities and delays development outcomes. These are the main reasons we are going through difficult times. If the leadership was up to task, the extent of suffering would be less than is the case.
column2: ny: Kuchuluka monyanya kwa ngongole zaboma ndi umboni wakuti boma likungotenga ngongole mwa chisawawa. Tidakumbutsidwa mwezi wapitawo kuti aliyense akuzenza ngongole ya K600,000 pa mutu pake. Chokhumudwitsa ndi kuti ngongole izi sizidapindulire ife tonse. Ndi ngongole zimene zimatengedwa kuti agawane kudzera mu katangale komanso kupatsana ma alawansi ochuluka kwa akulu akulu a boma. Kuonjezera apo, pakhala pali chidwi chochepa chofuna kusintha ndondomeko ya zachuma kuti tichepetse kapena kuchotsa kumene zinthu zosafunikira zimene zimangowonongetsa ndalama kwinaku tikudzala maziko a mphamvu okuza chuma chathu kuti ndalama za misonkho zichuluke. Taganizani kulephera kupeza ndalama tokha kuti tikonze damu la Kapichira kuti tibwezeretse mphamvu ya magetsi nsanga. Tachita kukapempha ngongole mbali inayo angotithandiza zimene zatenga nthawi yayitali magetsi ochepa kalewa akungothimathima. Nkhani ya ulesi wa adindo ena mu boma ndiye ngakhale a President ndi nduna zina akhala akudandaula. Tsono kuchedwetsa kuvomereza kuti ma pulojeketi ayambike kumabwezeretsa chitukuko m’mbuyo mu njira zosiyana siyana monga izi: i) ndalama zakunja zimasowa, ii) mwai wa ntchito umatsekerezedwa, iii) chitukuko chimachedwa.

column1: en: My colleagues and I come to offer genuine transformation. Malawi is a natural resource-rich and labour-abundant economy. Our economic policy will revolve around maximizing the potential in agriculture, mining, tourism and developing the human resource both in its own right and as catalysts for manufacturing. This will be done while progressively moving towards a knowledge economy by investing in science and technology.
column2: ny: Ndiye ndikati mavuto tikukumana nawo a zachuma mbali yayikulu ndi chifukwa cholephera kuyendetsa zinthu moyenera, zina ndi zimenezi. Utsogoleri ukadakhala wodziwa ntchito mavuto akanakhala koma omverera. Kuti mutsimikize kuti sizikukhudzana ndi zinthu zakunja koma zikugwirizana kwambiri ndi njira zoyendetsera chuma, dziko la Zambia chuma chawo chikuyenda bwino. Zambia ikukhudzidwa chimodzimodzi ndi nkhondo ya Ukraine ndi COVID-19 koma akuyendetsa bwino chuma.

column1: en: I will implement Malawi 2063 in its entirety. I am happy to inform you, fellow Malawians, that Malawi 2063 is a document I intimately subscribe to, because I was one of the reviewers. I also co-reviewed the enabler on enhanced public sector performance in the Malawi 2063 first 10 years Implementation Plan. My being identified as a person who could review this enabler is testimony that I understand the public service and I know how to make it perform. When I say I will implement it fully, I know what is in the document and I have adequate passion to implement it. I emphasize I because the responsibility for implementing a strategic plan in any organization is vested in the head of the organization. What makes a strategy work for one organization and fail for the other organization, is the quality of leadership of the organization. I will provide quality leadership.
column2: ny: Ine ndi anzanga tabwera kudzapereka kusintha kwenikweni. Dziko la Malawi liri ndi zonse za chilengedwe zoyenera pa chitukuko komanso liri ndi anthu olimbikira ntchito. Ndondomeko zathu zachuma zidzakhazikika popititsa patsogolo ntchito za ulimi, migodi, zokopa alendo komanso kuwonetsetsa kuti aliyense ali ndi mwai wophunzira bwino kuti tikhale ndi akatswiri pa ntchito zosiyana siyana. Pamene tikutukula chuma kudzera mu za chilengedwe zimene Chauta adatipatsa, tikhala tikupita chitsogolo molingana ndi kumene maiko ena akupita kuti chuma chathu tidzidalira za science ndi luso. Tidzatsatira mfundo za chitukuko zimene ziri mu Malawi 2063. Ndine wokondwa kukudziwitsani aMalawi anzanga kuti, Malawi 2063 ndi ndondomeko imene iri pa mtima wanga ndipo ndimazimvetsa bwino chifukwa ndinali m'modzi mwa owunikira ntchito yolemba ndondomeko imeneyi. Ndinaunikaranso mothandizana ndi ena pa nthambi ya kayendetsedwe ka boma mu ndondomeko yoyamba ya zaka 10 ya Malawi 2063 (Malawi 2063 First 10 Year Implementation Plan). Kundisankha kuti ndikhale mmodzi owunikira nthambi imeneyi ndi chitsimikizo kuti ndimadziwa kayendetsedwe ka boma. Ndikanena kuti tidzakwaniritsa zonse, ndikudziwa zomwe zili m'masophenyawa ndipo ndiri ndi chidwi chokwanira kuonetsetsa kuti Malawi 2063 atheke. Udindo wowonetsetsa kuti masomphenya atheke pa bungwe lirilonse ngakhale dziko umakhala mmanja mwa mkulu wa bungwelo. Ine ndidzapereka utsogoleri wapamwamba kuti masomphenya athu tonse akwaniritsidwe.

column1: en: We will transform agriculture through Mega farms and cooperatives which will facilitate mechanization, improve productivity, promote access to reliable markets for farmers, catalyze industrialization and urbanization. We will embark on infrastructure revolution agenda. From electricity generation, transport and ICT to residential and government office buildings.
column2: ny: Tidzatukula ulimi kudzera m'minda ikuluikulu (mega farms) ndi ma cooperative omwe adzathandizire kuchulukitsa zokolola, kulimbikitsa mwayi wopeza misika yodalirika kwa alimi, kukhazikitsa mafakitale ndi kutukula madera kukhala tawuni ndi mizinda. Tidzakhazikitsa ntchito ya zomangamanga mmagawo onse ofunika ntchito zomangamanga. Ntchito izi ndi monga za magetsi, za mtengatenga, nyumba za anthu ndi ma ofesi a boma.

column1: en: We will decisively support micro, small and medium enterprises. We will identify those which Malawi has comparative and competitive advantage to produce and have niche markets in the region and prioritize support to them. One key performance indicator for the Ministry of Industrialization and Trade will be the number of micro-scale enterprises graduating into small-scale; the number of small-scale enterprises graduating into medium-scale; the number of medium-scale graduating into large-scale annually. We will encourage and support Malawian large-scale enterprises to become multinational corporations. We denounce the glorification of the MSME concept as if that is the ideal destiny for them. They will be helped to grow.
column2: ny: Tidzathandizira mabizinesi ang'onoang'ono ndi apakatikati. Chimodzi mwa zolinga zazikulu za unduna wa Mafakitale ndi Malonda chidzakhala kuonetsetsa kuti mabizinezi ang'onoang'ono akule kuchoka pamene ali kufika pa mulingo wina wa patsogolo. Mabizinezi aMalawi amene ndi akulu kale adzathandizidwa kuti ayambe kutsakula ntchito zawo maiko ena. Tikukana ganizo lolemekezamabizinezi ang'onoang'ono ngati kuti ndiye akuyenera kuthera pomwepo. Iwo adzathandizidwa kuti akule.

column1: en: There are four main ways in which a country can benefit from its extractive resources which include mining. These are i) royalties, ii) resource rent iii) State participation and iv) taxes. So far, the component of State participation has not been exploited despite being the most beneficial way. To maximize benefits from mining, government will establish a Mining Company that will be getting into Joint Venture arrangement with foreign companies. Joint Venture arrangements will enable Malawians to be in management team and in the Board of Directors, thereby directly participating in running mining business and curb transfer pricing and other forms of illicit financial flows that often happen in mining industry. Your next government will review tax incentives to ensure Malawians get a fair share of their natural resources.
column2: ny: Pali njira zinai zikuluzikulu zimene dziko limapindulira ndi nkhani za migodi. Imodzi mwa njira zimenezi ndiye kuti dziko lidzikhala ndi gawo mu ntchito za migodi. Kuti izi zitheke, boma lanu lidzakhazikitsa kampani ya migodi. Kampani imeneyi idzidzachita mgwirizano ndi kampani za kunja kuti potero gawo la Malawi ku phindu limene lidzipezeka likhale lochuluka. Kuyendetsa businezi za migodi limodzi ndi ma kampani a kunja kudzathandiza kuti ife eni tidzichita nawo ziganizo ndikumaona kuti palibe njira zimene zikuchitika zoti tiberedwe ndalama podzera mu njira zozemba kupereka msonkho komanso ndalama ya umwini (dividend) chifukwa atinamiza kuti kampani siyidapange phindu. Tidzaunikanso misonkho imene imachotsedwa kuti ma kampani asamalipire. Ife tikufuna ntchito za migodi zipindulire a Malawi.

column1: en: We will approach tourism holistically and contextually. Tourism is about attraction. We will invest in areas that are unique to Malawi, one of them is establishing vibrant cultural centers and packaging our history into a commercial product. Tourism is a beneficiary of derived demand. Our resolve to develop the economy, develop manufacturing sector will positively contribute to the travel and tourism industry. We will make Malawi a destination for citizens of neighboring countries to come and shop. As they come, they will need accommodation and transport just as Malawians do when they travel outside.
column2: ny: Tidzatukula ntchito zokopa alendo mokwanira komanso mogwirizana ndi mmene dziko lathu liriri. Nkhani zokopa alendo zagona poyika chikoka kweni kweni chikoka pa zinthu zimene zingapezeke ku Malawi kokha kuno. Ife tidzayika chidwi ndi kutukula malo owonetsa za chikhalidwe komanso kufotokozera mbiri yathu kuti alendo adzikopeka kubwera kwathu kuno. Izi zidzakhala zowonjezera ku zomwe zakhala zikuchitika monga kuteteza nkhalango za nyama za ku tchire, malo opatsa chidwi ndi nyanja zathu. Khumbo lathu lofuna kutukula chuma, kukweza ntchito za mafakitale zidzathandizira kwambiri zokopa alendo. Tipanga Malawi kukhala dziko limene nzika za maiko oyandikana nawo adzibwera kudzagula katundu. Akabwera adzidzafuna malo ogona komanso mayendedwe ngati mmene a Malawi amachitira akapita kunja. Potero ntchito zokopa alendo zidzapita patsogolo.

column1: en: Agriculture transformation, infrastructure revolution, growing of MSMEs, mining, industrialization (manufacturing) and tourism will anchor our job creation agenda.
column2: ny: Tikatukula ulimi, tikakweza ntchito zomangamanga, za migodi, mafakitale, zokopa alendo komanso kutukula mabizinezi ang'onoang'ono, ndi zimene zidzakhale mzati wopanga mwai wa ntchito kwa a Malawi ambiri.

column1: en: My fellow Malawians, I am aware of the key drivers of cost of living. We will overhaul the fuel procurement system in the short-term while investing in cost- effective mode of transport such as rail and pipeline in line with the Malawi National Transport Master Plan. We will review all levies and remove or reduce those that can be done so without compromising public service delivery. We will work to achieve macroeconomic stability with a stable and relatively strong currency to contain imported inflation. In line with Malawi 2063, we will enhance agricultural productivity so that price of food is cheap while farmers still make profit.
column2: ny: A Malawi anzanga, ife tikudziwa kuti moyo umakhala owawa kweni kweni mu town chifukwa chokwera mitengo ya nyumba zogona, chakudya ndi ndalama zolipira mayendedwe. Pothana ndi mavuto amenewa, tidzaonetsetsa kuti boma likugula mafuta a galimoto kudzera ndondomeko zimene ziri zopulumutsa ndalama komanso misonkho imene inayikidwa pa mtengo wa mafuta tidzayiwunika kuti ina ichotsedwe kapena kuchepetsedwa ngati kutero sikungasokoneze kupereka ntchito zofunikira kwa aMalawi. Kuyang’ana chitsogolo, tidzakonza kuti mafuta adzibwera kudzera pa sitima ya pa njanje ndi paipi mogwirizana ndi ndondomeko ya Malawi National Transport Master Plan. Mfundo zathu za chuma zidzalunjika pa cholinga chakuti ndalama za kunja zidzipezeka kuti ndalama ya Kwacha ikhale ya mphamvu tikatero ndiye kuti mitengo ya katundu idzakhala yokhazikika. Mogwirizana ndi Malawi 2063, tidzathandiza alimi kuti adzikolola zochuluka kuti potero adzigulitsa pa mtengo womverera koma akupangabe phindu chifukwa akugulitsa katundu wambiri. Izi zidzathandiza kuti chakudya chidzipezeka pa mtengo wotsika kwa amene akugula pamene alimi nawonso akupanga phindu.

column1: en: We will embark on an ambitious home ownership program in which Malawi Housing Corporation will be recapitalized so it can build houses of different designs to suit your affordability. You will be paying monthly rental fee but which will be going towards purchase of the house. We will make home ownership easy for everyone. A well-thought housing scheme will be implemented in rural areas.
column2: ny: Boma lanu limene mupange 2025 potipatsa voti lidzayika chidwi pa nkhani yoti munthu aliyense akhale ndi nyumba yake. Tidzapereka ndalama ku bungwe la Malawi Housing Corporation kuti amange nyumba zosiyana siyana malingana ndi mapezedwe a munthu aliyense. Inu mudzapatsidwa nyumba mumalipira mwezi uliwonse monga muchitira pa renti koma ndalama yolipirayi ikugula nyumba kuti pakutha kwa nthawi mudzakhala kuti mwakwanitsa kulipira nyumba ikhala yanu. Tipanga umwini wanyumba kukhala wosavuta. Tidzayikanso ndondomeko yabwino yothandiza anthu a ku midzi kukhala ndi nyumba zabwino.

column1: en: My fellow Malawians, our approach to improving living standards focuses on containing cost of living on one hand and improving incomes on the other hand while investing in physical and human capital development to put a solid foundation for economic development. That is what your next government will do.
column2: ny: A Malawi anzanga, njira yathu yotukula miyoyo ya anthu ndikuonetsetsa kuti moyo wa tsiku ndi tsiku usazakhale oboola mthumba komanso kuti mwai wopeza ndalama udzipezeka. Izi ndi zomwe boma lanu likubwerari lidzachite.

column1: en: Public debt management will be key in getting the economy back on right track. Our resolve to decisively end corruption will free up resources and reduce the need for borrowing. Estimates based on previous government financial audits showed that 30% of the national budget is unaccounted for. When the system is fixed, we will save these funds and spend on intended projects. Our resolve to reform the fiscal plan so we remove unnecessary expenditure and we grow revenue base will reduce the need for borrowing. Reform of foreign missions will free up resources. Where we will have to borrow for legitimate reasons, these questions will guide in determining the source of borrowing; 1) will the loan help grow economy (GDP)? 2) will the loan help either grow tax revenue or reduce expenditure or both? 3) will the loan help grow exports? If the answer is NO especially to 2 and 3, no external loan will be contracted. If a loan still has to be secured, it will be domestic and using a long-term development bond.
column2: ny: Kuti chuma cha Malawi chiyambenso kuyenda bwino, mbali imodzi yofunika kukonza ndi ngongole zimene boma liri nazo. Choyamba ndikuchotsa zifukwa zimene zimatigwetsa mu ngongole. Izitu ndi monga katangale amene amachititsa kuti ndalama zambiri zidziwonongeka. Tikathana ndi katangale, tikachotsa zinthu zosafunika mu bajeti, tikakweza ntchito za chuma kuti ndalama za misonkho zidzibwera zambiri, tikakonza mu ma embassy athu maiko akunja kuti anthu okhawo ofunika ndiye adzikhala, tichepetsa kulekana kwa ndalama zimene boma limatolera ndi ndalama zimene boma limafuna kuti ligwiritse ntchito. Potero kubwereka ndalama kuchepa. Pamene tidzayenera kubwereka tidzaonetsetsa kuti pali zifukwa zomveka kutero ndipo mafunso awa adzatsogolera kuti tibwereke kwa ndani; 1) Kodi ngongoleyo ithandiza kukulitsa chuma (GDP)? 2) kodi ngongoleyo ithandiza kuchulukitsa ndalama zopezeka kudzera ku misonkho kapena ichepetsa ndalama zofunika kugwiritsidwa ntchito kapena zonse ziwiri? 3) Kodi ngongoleyo ithandizira kuchulukitsa katundu ogulitsa kunja? Ngati yankho liri AYI makamaka ku funso 2 ndi 3, palibe ngongole yakunja yomwe tidzatenge. Ngati ngongole iyenera kutengedwabe, idzakhala yobwerekedwa mu dziko momwe muno kudzera njira ya chiongola dzanja chotsika komanso kubweza kwa nthawi yayitali

column1: en: Reducing debt will feed into stimulating private sector development as commercial banks and other lenders will have enough liquidity to lend to private sector at competitive interest rates. Your next government will commit to clearing payment arrears as one way of capacitating private sector to operate fully, expand production and create additional jobs.
column2: ny: Tikadzachepetsa kubwereka ndalama ndiye kuti ma banki adzakhala ndi ndalama zambiri zoti adzibwereketsa kwa a ma bizinezi pa chiongola dzanja chotsikirako. Boma lanu likubwerari lidzaika chidwi chapadera kulipira katundu amene adatengedwa pa ngongole ndi cholinga chakuti eni bizinezi akuze mabizinezi awo komanso alembe ntchito anthu owonjezera.

column1: en: Corruption
column2: ny: Katangale ndi ziphuphu

column1: en: Corruption is a developmental challenge. It is a political campaign issue. Every leader promises to end corruption during political campaign yet corruption continues to worsen. Recent revelations of corruption are evident that our leaders are not only failing to end corruption, they are in fact participating in it.
column2: ny: Nkhani ya katangale ndi ziphuphu ndi imene imamanga nthenje pa misonkhano yokopa anthu nthawi ya chisankho. Chodwabwitsa n’chakuti atsogleri akalowa mu boma sangolephera kokha kuthetsa katangale koma amakaonjezera m’chitidwe wa katangalewo. Potengera zimene zavumbulutsidwa posachedwa zokhudza katangale, tonse tatsimikiza kuti atsogoleri athu akuchita nawo katangale.

column1: en: A large part of our poverty is due to corruption. We have had leaders who amass wealth for themselves through corruption and morally questionable entitlements and give us leftovers. Citizens have systematically been economically disempowered so we can depend on them. They use the same corruptly acquired wealth, stolen from the many taxes we pay, to coax us to side with them when they are caught on the wrong side of the law. They project a picture that any criminal investigation in their dealings is the work of their political rivals. We fight on their behalf even when they were the first to kill us through denying us access to education, healthcare, food and job and business opportunities.
column2: ny: Gawo lalikulu la umphawi wathu ndi chifukwa cha ziphuphu. Takhala ndi atsogoleri amene amadziunjikira okha chuma kudzera njira za katangale ndikumatigaila kangachepe kuchoka pa chuma chambiricho ife timawagwadira ngati akutichitira chifundo chonsecho atatibera ndalama za misonkho yathu. Mmalo motipatsa mwai kuti tidzizipezera tokha zosowa zathu, takhala ndi utsogoleri otipanga kuti tikhale wodalira pa anthu a ndale ngati wotipatsa thandizo. Potero adzitigwiritsa ntchito mmene angafunire. Iwo amagwiritsa ntchito chuma chachinyengo chomwechi, chobedwa pa misonkho yambiri yomwe timalipira, kutikopa kuti tikhale tchinga lawo akagwidwa pa mulandu wa katangale. Amapereka chithunzithunzi chakuti akamawafufuza pa zolakwika ndiye kuti ndi adani awo pa ndale amene akuwalonda. Ifetu timakhala nyambo, kuwatchingira chonsecho ndi iwo adayamba kutiphera ufulu wathu wa maphunziro, ntchito za umoyo, chakudya komanso mwai wa ntchito ndi bizinezi pamene amachita katangale.

column1: en: Malawi has enough financial resources to deliver public services adequately. Publicly available information confirm that it is possible to run a government without heavy borrowing. For example, it is alleged that in one contract, a business person charged government US$10,524,000 for goods that cost the business person US$2,165,700 making abnormal profit of US$8,358,300. Surely this is over- pricing and stealing from poor Malawians.
column2: ny: Dziko la Malawi liri ndi ndalama zokwanira zoperekera ntchito zotumikira aMalawi moyenera. Dziko la Malawi liri ndi kuthekera koyendetsa dongosolo la bajeti popanda kubwereka ndalama zambiri. Zina zimene zatuluka pa mbalambanda zokhudza katangale zikuonetsa kuti makhuluku a bizinezi amapereka katundu ku boma pa mtengo wa US$10,524,000 chonsecho iwo adaoda katundu yemweyo pa mtengo wa US$2,165,700. Kutanthauza kuti adapanga phindu la US$8,358,300. Palibetu bizinezi ya chilungamo imene munthu angagulitse katundu ndi kupeza phindu lalikulu motere.

column1:
en: Fellow Malawians, we all can see that the main problem in Malawi is not inadequate resources but corruption and excessive and expensive entitlements of senior public officers. Fighting corruption must be a top priority for a government. That is not the case unfortunately. Some of the reasons corruption is not ending include the expensive type of political campaign and the parasitic political party system. Statistics confirm that Malawi is a least developed country hence it is a country whose people are poor and by extension, a country whose politicians are poor. The type of political campaign that is practiced is expensive and breeds a fertile ground for advance State capture by those who bankroll the campaign. Corrupt business
people finance greedy politicians in anticipation of easy access to business contracts once the politician or political party is in power. This is what has sustained State capture.
column2: ny: A Malawi anzanga, kuti tipite patsogolo ngati dziko, tiyambe tathetsa katangale. Koma chifukwa chiyani katangale sakutha? Ndikubenthulirani zifukwa zake ndi izi: Chifukwa choyamba ndi mmene timachitira ndale. Pamene owona za chuma amatsimikiza kuti Malawi ndi dziko la anthu osauka, ndale zathu zimakhala zofuna ndalama za nkhani nkhani zimene anthu a ndale alibe. Iwo amagwirizana ndi makhuluku a bizinezi kuti awapatse ndalama cholinga chakuti akadzawina makhuluku a bizinezi adzaphangire mwai wa bizinezi za boma ndikumayika mtengo wokwera kwambiri. Ukutu nkutipangitsa pinyolo.

column1: en: In State capture, the loser is the citizenry. Politicians influence award of government contracts to corrupt business people at inflated prices. The inflated prices are because the corrupt business people want to i) recover the money they spent to bankroll campaign, ii) sell the goods and services at a profit and iii) give part of the payment to the politicians so they remain connected. When the politicians get part of the payment they use part of the money for their personal projects and part of it for campaign materials and other political expenses. That is why the fight against corruption cannot be won if we continue using the same political campaign model. In fact, there are politicians who have established businesses out of money acquired in this way. Their businesses get contracts from the same government they stole capital from. In other words, our tax money has become business capital for greedy politicians and the businesses get contracts from government where they are paid by our tax money again. This is the height of impunity in Malawi. We all have a responsibility to stop this.
column2: ny: A ndale akalandira ndalama kwa khuluku wa bizinezi amene walipidwa ndi misonkho yathu, iwo amayambitsa ma kampani amene amaphangiranso mwai wa bizinezi ku boma. Potero ndalama za misonkho yathu zikukhala mpamba woyambitsira bizinezi za a ndale a dyera ndipo bizinezi zake zimalipidwa ndi misonkho yathunso akaperekera katundu. Apa ndi pamene chisembwere chafika mdziko lathu lino. Tonse tiri ndi udindo wothetsa zimenezi. Chifukwa cha chiwiri n’chakuti zipani za ndale zimafuna ndalama zambiri zoyendetsera koma zilibe bizinezi iliyonse yopezera ndalamazo. Atsogoleri a ndale amasaka ndalama zoyendetsera chipani kugwiritsa ntchito njira za katangale kapena kuba ku boma.

column1: en: My fellow Malawians, let me illustrate how corruption causes poverty. Suppose there was money enough to construct three school blocks but due to corruption the price is inflated and the money can only construct two school blocks. Suppose each school block has two classrooms that can accommodate 60 learners. Further, suppose constructing a school block offers job opportunity to ten people as bricklayers, carpenters and others. column2: ny: AMalawi anzanga, ndiloleni ndikufotokozereni mmene ziphuphu zimabweretsera umphawi. Tiyerekeze kuti panali ndalama zokwanira kumanga midadada itatu ya sukulu koma chifukwa cha katangale mtengo wakwera ndipo ndalamazo zingomanga midadada iwiri yokha. Tiyerekeze kuti mdadada uliwonse uli ndi makalasi awiri otha kukhala ana ophunzira 60. Komanso, tiyerekeze pomanga sukulu iliyonse, pakhala mwayi wa ntchito kwa anthu 10 ngati ma bilidala, akalipentala ndi ena. Pomanga midadada iwiri m'malo mwa itatu chifukwa cha katangale, zotsatira zake ndi izi

column1: en: Three blocks would have made 360 learners move from learning under a tree to a proper classroom, but due to corruption only 240 learners will be in a good classroom. The other 120 learners will continue learning under a tree yet money was available to put them in a good classroom.
column2: ny: Midadada itatu ikadapangitsa kuti ophunzira 360 asamuke kuchoka pakuphunzira pansi pa mtengo kupita ku kalasi yabwino, koma chifukwa cha katangale, ndi ana 240 okha omwe akhale ndi makalasi abwino. Ophunzira ena 120 akupitirira kuphunzira pansi pa mtengo ngakhalendalama zinalipo zowaika m’kalasi yabwino.

column1: en: Constructing three school blocks would create employment opportunities to 30 people. By constructing two, it means 10 people who would have some work to do still have no job.
column2: ny: Kumanga midadada itatu kudakapereka mwayi wa ntchito kwa anthu 30. Pomanga awiri, zikutanthauza kuti anthu 10 omwe adakapeza ntchito yoti agwire, alibe ntchito

column1: en: Since there is corruption, there is high likelihood that the two school blocks may be of substandard quality. They may need maintenance quicker than if construction was not marred with corruption. Additional resources are likely to be spent to rehabilitate the same school blocks when the resources would have been spent on other functions.
column2: ny: Popeza pali katangale, pali chiopsezo kuti midadada ya sukulu ziwirizi ikhala yosalimba. Itha kufunika kukonzedwanso mwachangu kuposa momwe idakafunikira chikhala kuti ntchito yomanga siyinalowe ziphuphu. Ndalama zina zifunika kukonzanso midadada ya masukulu yomwewo pomwe zikanagwiritsidwa ntchito zina.

column1: en: If children are learning under a tree; if there are no drugs in health facilities; if there are no all-weather roads in some areas; if jobs are scarce; if we Malawians are poor; one of the main causes is corruption.
column2: ny: Ngati ana akuphunzira pansi pa mtengo; ngati mulibe mankhwala m'zipatala; ngati m'madera ena kulibe misewu yabwino; ngati ntchito zikusowa; ngati tiri osauka; chimodzi mwa zifukwa zazikulu ndi ziphuphu.

column1: en: Our approach to the fight against corruption starts from the process of getting into office. We will not do the traditional political campaign you have known. We will not do because we do not want to get money from corrupt business people so that when you vote us into office we serve them instead of serving you, Malawians.
column2: ny: Njira yathu yolimbana ndi katangale ikuyambira pakalowedwe mu boma. Sitipanga kampeni (campaign) monga amachitira ena. Sititero chifukwa sitifuna kupeza ndalama kwa makhuluku a bizinezi kuti mukativotera titumikire iwo m’malo motumikira inu a Malawi.

column1: en: We will not form a political party because it is an expensive organization that contributes to temptation of political leaders to indulge in corruption and when in office, abuse public resources to fund the political party. You can relate this to some of the revelations that are coming out now of how public institutions financed activities of a political party. We do not want to tie ourselves to the yokes that have chained the others. More importantly, not forming a political party means that there will be no group of people (members of the ruling party) that feels and behaves as more important than the rest of Malawians. Between me and the public service, there will be no person or group of people to terrorize public servants on the premise that they are the ruling party members.
column2: ny: Sitipanga chipani cha ndale chifukwa ndi chinthu chofuna ndalama zambiri chimene chimapangitsa kuti atsogoleri andale akopeke ndi katangale ndipo akakhala paudindo amawononga chuma chaboma popereka ndalama ku zipani. Sitikufuna kudziyika ku goli limene lakhala likulemera atsogoleri ena ndikuwapangitsa kuti nkhondo yothana ndi katangale isatheke. Tawona zimene zimachitika kuti chipani chikalowa m’boma iwo a mbali yolamula amadzimva kuti ndi anthu ofunika kuposa a Malawi ena. Ina mwa milandu imene tikumva yokhudza katangale ikukhudza anthu amene ndi akuluakulu a chipani amene amawopseza wogwira ntchito ku boma pogwiritsa ntchito mphamvu za ku chipani. Ine ndikufuna Malawi amene pasadzakhale wina wosokoneza boma poganiza kuti ali ndi mphamvu kapena ndiwofunika kwambiri kuposa a Malawi ena.

column1: en: It is not an exaggeration to say that political parties have been a disuniting factor so far in Malawi as they have been catalyst for tribalism and nepotism. You may appreciate the observation that in some political parties, it does not matter how loyal and qualified a member is, if they do not come from a particular region or from a particular tribe they cannot be voted president of a party to have a chance to contest as president of a country. We must for a moment dismantle this construct and create a political system that gives hope to every Malawian everywhere that they can be anything including President of Malawi if they work hard, have qualifications and have the integrity to serve their nation. I am convinced that being a president without a political party will foster nation building.
column2: ny: Ndikukhulupirira kuti mugwirizana nane kuti zipani zakhala gawo limodzi lolimbikitsa tsankho potengera chigawo chochokera ndi mtundu. Zipani zina ndithu ngakhale membela atakhala wokhulupirika chotani akhala ndizomuyenereza, sangasankhidwe kukhala president wa chipani kuti akhale ndi mwai woyimira u president wa dziko ngati sachokera chigawo china kapena ngati si wa mtundu wina. Ndine wotsimikizika kuti kukhala president opanda chipani kudzapanga ntchito yoyanjanitsa a Malawi kukhala yopepuka.

column1: en: Additionally, as your leader, I will have all my focus on running government, rather than divide my focus between running government on one hand and running a political party on the other hand.
column2: ny: Kuphatikiza apo, mudzakhala ndi mtsogoleri amene chidwi chake chonse chidzakhale kuyendetsa dziko kuti titukuke mmalo mokhala ndi chidwi chogawanika pakati poyendetsa dziko ndi kuyendetsa chipani.

column1: en: Fighting corruption is a war. Being a war, it needs troops who are loyal to their nation, troops who are well-trained and well-resourced. Above all, troops who are best commanded. The agencies responsible for fighting corruption are the troops. The President is the commander. Like in a military war, if troops are compromised, it is difficult to win the fight against corruption. If the commander is compromised, it is impossible to win the fight against corruption.
column2: ny: Nkhondo yothana ndi katangale ndi ngati nkhondo ya asilikali. Imafunika kuti mabungwe amene udindo wawo ndi kuthana ndi katangale akhale ndi anthu amene ndi wokonda dziko lawo, wophunzira bwino, ali ndi zipangizo zofunika zokwanira komanso akutsogoleredwa bwino. Wotsogolera nkhondo imeneyi ndi President. Ngati mabungwe amenewa kapena anthu ena mu mabungwe amenewa angakhale wogwirizana ndi anthu amene akukhudzidwa ndi katangale kweni kweni ngati President angakhale wogwirizana ndi anthu a katangale, sizingatheke kupambana nkhondo imeneyi.

column1: en: For the reason that we will not get into office through a corrupt process, you can be assured that my team and I will fight against corruption decisively for we will not be haunted by our own involvement in the same. I will take it my prime responsibility that the fight against corruption is ably commanded and that if there are elements of compromised loyalty in the troops, I take corrective measures. I can guarantee that under my stewardship, no effort will be spared to fight corruption.
column2: ny: Pachifukwa chakuti sitidzalowa m'boma ndi njira za ziphuphu, khulupirirani kuti tidzathetsa katangale. Nkhondo yolimbana ndi katangale idzakhala yosatsamwitsa chifukwa sitidzacheuka m’mbuyo nkumati koma awa tiwamanga bwanji pakuti adathandizanso ife. Ife tidzakutumikirani aMalawi mowona mtima. Ine ndidzatsogolera nkhondo imeneyi modzipereka, mwaukadaulo ndi mowona mtima.

column1: en: The future of Malawi leadership
column2: ny: Tsogolo la utsogoleri wa Malawi

column1: en: Fellow Malawians, I understand the frustration among well-meaning Malawians. I am aware that some of you have lost interest in voting in next election because we have been disappointed by the political administrations we have had. I come to give hope. I come to restore the courage we always have had, believing that as citizens, power is in our hands to make a leadership that has i) integrity, ii) technical and administrative competence and iii) desire to serve.
column2: ny: A Malawi anzanga ndikumvetsa kukhumudwa komwe kulipo pakati pa aMalawi akufuna kwabwino. Ndikudziwa kuti ena mwa inu mwataya chidwi chofuna kuvota pachisankho chikubwerachi chifukwa takhumudwitsidwa ndi utsogoleri kwa nthawi yayitali. Ndabwera kudzapereka chiyembekezo. Ndabwera kudzabwezeretsa kulimba mtima komwe takhala nako, pokhulupirira kuti monga nzika, mphamvu ziri m'manja mwathu kupanga utsogoleri womwe uli ndi i) Ungwiro, ii) Ukadaulo ndi iii) Kutumikira.

column1: en: The 2025 presidential election will be a ‘referendum’ - a choice between maintaining impunity versus ending impunity; a choice between maintaining mediocrity versus a launch of meritocracy; a choice between politicians versus leaders.
column2: ny: Chisankho cha pulezidenti cha 2025 chidzakhala ‘referendum’ - kusankha pakati pa kupitiriza kuponderezedwa kapena kuthetsa utsogoleri wopendereza nzika zake. Kusankha kupitiriza za chibwana zolephera kuyendetsa chuma ndi boma moyenera kapena kuyamba utsogoleri wa ukadaulo woyendetsa chuma ndi boma. Kusankha pakati pa andale kapena atsogoleri.

column1: en: To echo the words of Barack Obama, former President of the USA, “we did not inherit the country from our ancestors so we can feel a sense of entitlement, rather we borrowed it from our children and the generations to come and therefore we have an obligation to hand over a better country to them”.
column2: ny: Ndibwereze mawu a Mr. Barack Obama, mtsogoleri wakale wa USA, "ife sitinatenge dziko kuchokera kwa makolo athu kotero kuti titha kuliwononga chifukwa ndi lathu, m'malo mwake tidabwereka dzikoli kwa ana athu ndi mibadwo ikubwera, kutero tikuyenera kulisamala kuti tidzabweze dziko labwino.”

column1: en: We have a responsibility to change the narrative that politics is for the few rich Malawians more so those getting rich through corruption and theft of public resources. We have a duty to change the narrative that politics is for crooks, liars, the incompetent and that politics is risky.
column2: ny: Tiri ndi udindo wosintha kaganizidwe kakuti ndale ndi za anthu wolemera kweni kweni pamene kulemerako kudabwera chifukwa cha kuba ndalama zathu za misonkho. Tiri ndi udindo wotembenuza maganizo kuti ndale ndi za anthu za makhuluku, a bodza, osatha ntchito komanso kuti ndale ndi zowopsa.

column1: en: My colleagues and I are at your service and are determined to make personal sacrifices for the sake of presenting a real choice to you in the next elections. We come so that as voters you are not faced with a choice between lemons and grapefruits (manyumwa), for both are sour. We come to be your real choice. We know the contenders are heavily armoured with resources, including those they stole from our taxes.
column2: ny: Ine ndi anzanga takonzeka kukutumikirani. Tadzipereka nsembe podziyika pa chiopsezo chomwe chingabwere ndi cholinga chakuti inu mukhale ndi kusankha kwenikweni. Tabwera kuti musachite jenkha kusowa chosankha pakati ma mandimu ndi manyumwa pakuti zonse ndizowawasa. Ife tabwera kuti mukhale ndi atsogoleri amene muwasankhe mokondwera kuti mwasankha bwino. Tikudziwa kuti amene tidzapikisane nawo ali ndi ndalama zambiri, kuphatikiza zomwe adaba ku misonkho yathu.

column1: en: We are armoured with faith. We believe we shall succeed with your support. We are ready to govern and to do so competently. I have the right training, experience and exposure to public policy to competently develop the economy and run the public service. As you may appreciate, the duty of any government is two-fold; i) to develop the economy with the aim of improving people’s living standards and ii) to manage the public service so it can deliver public goods and services to people professionally, efficiently and effectively. I promise to deliver on these two cardinal roles in an excellent manner.
column2: ny: Ife chida chathu ndi chikhulupiriro. Tikukhulupirira kuti tidzapambana ndi thandizo lanu. Ndife okonzeka kutsogolera dziko lathu mwaukatswiri. Monga mukudziwa ntchito za utsogoleri wa dziko ziri pawiri motere i) kudziwa kayendetsedwe ka chuma kuti miyoyo ya anthu ipite patsogolo, ii) kudziwa kayendetsedwe ka boma kuti ntchito zotumikra anthu zidziyenda bwino. Ine ndidzagwira ntchito imeneyi modzipereka, mwaukadaulo ndi mowona mtima.

column1: en: I appeal to you Malawians to support my candidacy. I am ready to serve you. In a special way, I encourage the youth to take 2025 election as uniquely important for I, one of their own, will be on the ballot paper. I am going to run the government in ways that will prove that the youth in Malawi are ready for the task. I will take it my additional responsibility to bring public confidence in the youth and in doing so clear a way for all youth who seek elected positions. I promise a government that will be at your service. I promise an administration that will be the moral campass of the nation.
